reviews.review: El juego es bastante entretenido y funciona bien la idea, es adictivo y divertido de jugar con amigos. El problema es que BHVR no le importa mantener bien su juego, cada DLC o actualización que introducen termina rompiendo el juego, la optimización está horrible, el juego tiene un pésimo balance y con los cambios al emparejamiento sólo se ha vuelto peor. A BHVR parece no importarle lo que piensa la comunidad y lo peor de todo es que la "competencia" del juego no puede superar DBD haciendo que no se preocupen por perder sus ganancias. Espero que en algún momento puedan cambiar todo lo malo que están haciendo ya que es un juego bastante bueno pero sufre de tener unos desarrolladores mediocres

遊戲本身很好玩也很有趣，少部分主流技能與大部分非主流技能，搞耍起來都很好玩，但是這都建立在鬼不守屍人不速修的情況，要是人類牙起來修只要鬼追到稍微會玩會遛的直接爆炸，鬼牙起來守你直接跳窗看YT等下一場，ping值高低也非常影響遊戲體驗，時常被髒刀髒板已經都是常態就當作自己偶爾也可以髒到XD，路人隊友看到鬼在守屍幾乎不是修一修自己跑就是不知道怎麼辦然後一直送刀，有時候遇到會處理的真的會感動到哭出來，遛鬼每個人實力不同就不多做評論，所以看到吃刀不轉點翻板翻板還沒壓到的不用太意外，要慢慢習慣沒有板子遛鬼XD，從恐怖遊戲玩到變競技遊戲，從驚嚇到經常氣死，到現在已經看透這個糞game被bm被守屍被遛昏被速修各種bug都已經習慣了，大不了碎碎念一下繼續下一把。

Not to mention assuring your fan base one day that you aren't involved or associating with NFT's, then boom haha its been great working boss protocol and were involved all along. For what its worth I'm not being a part of this and uninstalled the game. Dont bother buying, spend those hard earned smackaroos somewhere else.

Dead by daylight is a great game to play with friends or solo. It is a game that requires a lot of time and effort to become good at the game, but over all it is an amazing game been playing for a year now and if the Devs keep up what they are going and we get constant updates and map reworks I'm going to be playing this game for a long time.

You know, it's a real shame I have to write this review. I love this game. It's super fun and I've sunk more hours into this game than any other game I own. The problem I have with DBD is the dev team. First of all, the devs manage to fuck up almost every single patch. Glaring issues take forever to get fixed. That being said, this has been an issue for a long time now and unfortunately it's something the player base has had to get used to. What inspired me to write this review is the Behavior's disgusting amount of greed. Paying for a stupid amount of DLC just to be able to keep up with the meta and microtransations were just the beginning apparently. Now Behavior has introduced NFT's into their game (EDIT: since writing this review I've realized that NFT's aren't in the actual game. Character models are being sold as NFT's on a platform outside of DBD. However, this is still quite a cash grab and a shitty thing to do imo). Are you kidding me???? BHVR should be ashamed of themselves.

While I'm at it, I should mention that this game isn't new-user friendly by any means. In order to be caught up with the meta, you need to grind super hard to unlock different perks/addons for all your characters. This has been an issue in the game since I started playing and yet the devs refuse to acknowledge it or make any attempt at fixing it.

They sell Hellraiser chapter without telling their customer about NFT, but now it's a thing in DbD.
Hope steam ban this game too.

Developers engaging with NFTs, a practice that benefits nobody but wastes energy, all so you can have URL that points towards a picture of Pinhead, completely creatively and morally bankrupt to jump onto a terrible pointless fad

Game is fine. There's a lot of balancing issues that won't get fixed untill the 4v1 asymetrical horror genre gets some real competition, but the game is fun to play from time to time. However, Behavior collaborating with NFT's is the last drop for me. Making a shitty game is one thing, using your shitty game to actively harm the enviroment is something entirely else. I discourage anyone to buy this game and I will myself stop playing it, assuming that they won't change their minds on this issue last second.

As most people in the community, I've had my issues with BHVR especially recently with the SBMM even thought EVERYONE was against it. Still, I took a break and went back to the game and still managed to enjoy it and get a couple of decent matches, although it's not a fair and good match making system for sure.
With the NFT's, I can't recommend this game... I don't know for how much longer I'll play the game, I was excited for Mikaela since I'm a survivor main and love witches but this NFT situation stinks and it's beyond horrible... 
So I don't recommend it for that particular reason...

Written as of Patch 6.1.3

Dead by Daylight is a game where you can either be a killer trying to take down a group of survivors before they escape, or you can play with your friends or solo survivor. Genuinely a fun game to pick up and play once and awhile but has enough depth to be worth sinking more time into. Best enjoyed with friends tbh.

They've reduced the harsh grind (its still there but feasible now) and BHVR is taking active steps to rebalance perks and maps to be more interactive and fair. Truthfully I used to consider this game not worth the time investment it was asking of casual players but right now its in the best spot its ever been. Give it a try!

Fuck NFTs and this garbage SBMM. I already wasn't having fun with the game since they implemented it but the fucking NFT bullshit took the cake. Thanks BHVR. For what? For wasting my money and my 358 hours of playing the game, half of that time was me actually enjoying the game and the rest was pure fucking pain because of your dumb decisions. I want my 20 bucks back please.

lying nft loser devs

Absolutely DO NOT buy this game until the devs make some MAJOR overhauls to their priorities, which may not ever happen. DBD has been completely miserable to play for the past month after their ranking overhaul update, but it had big problems even before then that's caused me to uninstall and take long hiatuses in the past.

One of the biggest issues right now is the new MMR system which is *supposed* to match you with players of equal skill, but it has quite a hard time doing that when it only bases your skill off of ONE metric which isn't even indicative of how well you did in a match. If you are in low MMR, expect tons of cheaters (that legitimately NEVER get punished btw, they only say they MIGHT take action if YOU record or stream your game and send it to them as evidence), useless teammates, and toxic killers that will shut you down from even playing the game. If you make it to high MMR, expect tryhard sweat-fests featuring the few meta killers and perks that make it impossible to enjoy unless you're playing with a lobby of friends. 

Also if you care about the environment, the devs have been promoting an NFT that they made the models for, saying NOTHING about it only until months after its associated DLC has been out and people have already been buying it. They just do not care about their community because what matters to them is numbers, and this game, despite its major flaws, has almost tripled in its playerbase size since this time last year due to it having basically no competition in its niche. They'll only start to listen when their sales go down enough, so please, DO NOT buy Dead by Daylight.

New player here, only been playing for like a month, but I have a fair number of hours in now. I think the game is fun but there is a caveat to that: balancing is a bit whack and matchmaking is terrible. If you play just to have fun and laugh you'll enjoy the game more, if you are playing to hardcore win try not to get tilted as your team mates hide in lockers all game or work with the killer. The community is 50% lovely and super nice with a large LGBTQIA+ following and 50% trolls from League of Legends here to ruin everyones day. 

Also Hackers. Look on Tik Tok or YouTube, this game has soooooo many hackers. I suggest if you get a hacker in the match that you just take the depip and report them after. Dont engage, it makes them think their actions are interesting. Just walk away, make some food, watch a TV show and hope they are not still holding your game hostage when you get back.
